page.title: 06WADES FARM,ADELAIDE (i)
page.content: Wades Farm is owned by Greens of Soham and is exclusively arable. It is situated off Stuntney Causeway and covers two hundred and fifty hectares (700 acres). People have been living there ever since the Fens were drained .The farm's main produce is potatoes and celery.There are five crops in rotation and these are potatoes,celery,onions,wheat and redbeet.The old farm was made up of many small strips but the dykes have been filled in to make larger fields. The produce is sent to Greens' own pack-houses in Soham then sold to Tesco's or Sainsbury's. Wades Farm produce one third of the country's beetroot. Greens' farms provide forty per-cent of English celery and twenty per-cent comes from Wades Farm.The potatoes are sold to Whitworth and Ross.
